fieldData.title: Extension of unemployment benefits to self-employed
fieldData.calc_subMinorCategory: Extensions of  income support to workers not covered by any kind of protection scheme
fieldData.descriptionBackgroundInfo: On 18 April 2020 additional regulations regarding unemployed have been amended to the legislation. Amendments were prepared by the Ministry of Welfare with a goal to ease up the acquisition of unemployment status and to maintain it while involved in temporary work. The Ministry claims that the changes are necessary to mitigate the consequences of the deteriorating economic situation and to reduce the negative consequences of the COVID-19 pandemic.The Law on Support for Unemployed Persons and Persons Seeking Employment and the law On Unemployment Insurance have been amended.
fieldData.descriptionContentOfMeasure: The amendment to the Law on Support for Unemployed Persons and Persons Seeking Employment expands the range of persons who are eligible to receive status of unemployed person. The amendments stipulate that until 31 December 2020, the owner of a micro-enterprise within the meaning of the Microenterprise Tax Law, if the micro-enterprise has no turnover will also have the right to obtain unemployment status. The norm includes also self-employed with no income.The other amendments to the same law stipulate that until 31 December 2020, a person maintain the unemployment status if a person is employed not more than twice in a 12-month period for a total period not exceeding 120 days. Until now, the law has allowed an unemployed person to become temporarily employed or self-employed for a period of up to 60 days in a 12-month period.Amendments on 24 April 2020 introduced additional “unemployment assistance benefit”. If the period of unemployment benefit ends after 12 March 2020, and the person is still unemployed, the additional benefit is available for the period of four months in the amount of €180. The norm is in force till 31 December 2020.
fieldData.descriptionUseOfMeasure: So far there is no information on how many unemployed have used the opportunity to work while maintaining status of unemployed. According to the data from the State Social Insurance agency, in May 901 people received unemployment assistance benefit, in June 2018 people, in July 3,140 people, in August 4,247 people, and in September 4,840 people.
fieldData.descriptionInvolvementOfSocialPartners: Social partners participate in discussions on measures for the prevention and suppression the spread of COVID-19 and on crisis impact on economy. However specific opinions of social partners regarding this specific measure are not published.
fieldData.statusOfRegulation: New aspects included into existing measure
